intro: Echidnopsis oviflora, commonly known as the eggplant orchid, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its unique, egg-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a terrestrial orchid with a short, stocky stem and broad, fleshy leaves. Its flowers are usually pale green to yellowish in color, with a distinctive, elongated shape. Echidnopsis oviflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking and unusual floral appearance.
